Questions.QuestionText: Show the formula you would use to calculate the width required for sheers.
Questions.AnswerText:
(4" past + 3" trim + 48" window width + 3" trim + 4" past) x 3 fullness + 6" selvage (only need 1 because it is one panel)
Full width from above equation / 36 (number of inches in a year)

Questions.QuestionText: What are your answers for the first and second parts of the above equations?
Questions.AnswerText: 192" and 5.3 yards, rounded up to 5 ½ yards minimum.

Questions.QuestionText: What is the formula for calculating the length of the sheers? Remember, you must use railroading. Sheer is 118" wide.
Questions.AnswerText: 8' ceiling = 96" - ½" from floor - 1" from ceiling for I-beam

Questions.QuestionText: What is your answer for the length using the above formula?
Questions.AnswerText: 94.5" finished length, which is enough to railroad making width the length and have no seams in the sheer

Questions.QuestionText: What is the equation to find the length for the rod needed?
Given the equation you used for the rod length, what is the correct measurement needed?
Questions.AnswerText: 62" rod ( 5'2" length needed for rod). Order a 6' rod and cut to size on install.
